data.title: Swiss court rejects Tunisia appeal against Ben Ali assets decision
data.meta_description: The Federal Criminal Court has thrown out an appeal by Tunisian authorities to freeze the funds of three brothers linked to Ben Ali assets.
data.text:
News

More

UBS questioned by US Senator over $350 million tax evasion case

This content was published on UBS has been asked by a powerful US lawmaker about whether Credit Suisse failed to report an American accused of evading taxes on $350 million in income.

Read more: UBS questioned by US Senator over $350 million tax evasion case

More

Half of Swiss back fireworks as part of national day celebrations

This content was published on According to a survey, half of Swiss consider fireworks to be an important part of the August 1 national holiday. However, a majority are against fireworks being set off by private individuals.

Read more: Half of Swiss back fireworks as part of national day celebrations

More

Swiss model killed in Bangkok in suspected stabbing

This content was published on Police suspect the 24-year-old's husband of having stabbed her to death in the south-east of the city last week.

Read more: Swiss model killed in Bangkok in suspected stabbing

More

Swiss-bound passengers affected by Frankfurt airport protest

This content was published on A climate protest at Frankfurt airport affected several Swiss International Air Lines flights on Thursday morning.

Read more: Swiss-bound passengers affected by Frankfurt airport protest

More

Switzerland’s drug approval process lags behind Europe

This content was published on According to a recent study, medicines are approved on average 249 days later in Switzerland than by the European Medicines Agency (EMA).

Read more: Switzerland’s drug approval process lags behind Europe

More

Non-believers significantly underrepresented in Swiss parliament

This content was published on While non-believers make up the largest group in the Swiss population at around 34%, they rank only third in Parliament with just 23%.

Read more: Non-believers significantly underrepresented in Swiss parliament

More

Swiss NGO offices in Ukraine hit by Russian strike

This content was published on On Wednesday morning, the offices of the Swiss Foundation for Demining (FSD) were struck by a Russian missile in Kharkiv, eastern Ukraine.

Read more: Swiss NGO offices in Ukraine hit by Russian strike

More

Climate activists block road to Zurich Airport

This content was published on A group of climate protesters blocked the road to Zurich Airport on Wednesday morning. The police quickly cleared the demonstration.

Read more: Climate activists block road to Zurich Airport

More

Surge in PhDs in Switzerland driven by international students

This content was published on The number of PhD students in French-speaking Switzerland has doubled over the past 30 years, largely due to the influx of international students.

Read more: Surge in PhDs in Switzerland driven by international students
